original_title: 40 killed, hundreds injured in suicide bombing at political rally in Pakistan
original_body_lines: At least 40 people have been killed after a suicide bomber set off explosives during a political rally in north western Pakistan, according to reports.
The blast occurred when a bomb ripped through a crowd of supporters of hard-line cleric and political leader Maulana Fazl-ur-Rehman, according to local officials.
Over 130 people have been reported injured in the incident on the outskirts of Khar, the capital of Bajur district in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, near the border with Afghanistan.
The provincial police chief Akhtar Hayat said the explosion was caused by a suicide bomb, Reuters reported.
Some of the injured were taken to the main hospital in the city where an emergency has been declared, while others were airlifted to Timergara and Peshawar.
